modName: Immersive 360 Controller with 8 Hotkeys - Expanded Edition
summary:
Now you can finally seamlessly access all 8 hotkeys, quicksave and access the Magic, inventory, Map and Perk menu from the 360 controller with just the push of a button.

Who needs a keyboard when you can do it all from your controller?
descriptionHtml:
Immersive 360 Controller with 8 Hotkeys - Expanded Edition v1.5



Installing and Updating: Extract the file on the \"The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim\" directory, overwriting the old file if updating, then once in game go to options, controls and click Y to restore the controls to the defaults settings to enable the hot keys.



---Description---
For some reason us poor 360 owners are left with only 2 hotkeys, how can a company
make such an amazing game and make such a horrible easily avoidable decision is beyond me, this mod 
addresses that issue by enabling all 8 hotkeys with the 360 controller, now you can finally seamlessly
access all 8 hotkeys, use the quicksave feature and access the Magic, Inventory, Map and Perk menu from the 360 controller with
just the push of a button.


What this file does is:

1.Change the D-PAD on the 360 controller to be able to activate all 8 Hotkeys, you will
now have to use the Left control stick to navigate the favorite menu, the D-Pad will still
scroll on all other menus normally.


2.The hotkey can be activated by just pressing the D-pad, the
other 4 are activated by pressing the D-Pad direction while holding the \"LB\" key.


3.Disabled the \"wait\" button on the main version, I always found it unrealistic that you could rest 4 feet away
from a hostile enemy for many many hours to regenerate life, magic and stamina and the enemy
would never notice you, don\'t they patrol the area? I guess trying to figure out if they left
the iron on back at home is more important than the 7 foot, 600 pound orc wearing full plate armor and
wielding a 12 foot axe forged from the very fire of hells that is very obviously giving you the
\"Once I regenerate I am going to use your and your childrens head as a cup\" look.


4.The \"back\" button is now used to manage the \"Favorites\" menu.



D-Pad Hotkey Assignment:
Left=1
Right=2
Up=3
Down=4

LB+Left=5
LB+Right=6
LB+Up=7
LB+Down=8

A+Start=Quicksave

If using the rest enabled version: 
LB+Back=Wait

If using expanded version:
A+Left=Inventory Shotcut
A+Right=Magick Shortcut
A+Up=Perk Shortcut
A+Down=Map Shortcut

Version history:
1.5 Added 2 new version, these extended versions can access the Map, inventory, perk, and magic menu by pessing A pluse
the appropiate direction. 
1.3 Changed the button presses to quicksave as it was causing sprinting problems with LB, quicksave has
now been changed to A+Start
1.2 Added quicksave function by pressing LB+Start.
1.1 Added optional file with wait enabled by pressing LB+Back.
1.0 Initial Release



Uninstall:
Remove the file, and go to control options and restore they buttons to default. 



Thanks:
crazy-g, NVShacker. Without them I would still be using the favorites menu with only 2 hotkeys.
